DocsBot AI allows you to build AI-powere: DocsBot AI allows you to build AI-powered chatbots that pull answers from your existing documentation and content. This integration enables workflows to ask DocsBot questions and update its training sources dynamically.
The API key for authenticating with Docs: The API key for authenticating with DocsBot.
Ask a question to a specific bot in a sp: Ask a question to a specific bot in a specific team.
Create a new source for a bot.
Upload a file to be used as a source.
Make a custom API call to a specific end: 将一个自定义 API 调用到一个特定的终点
Question: Question
Name: 名称
The question to ask the bot. 2 to 500 ch: The question to ask the bot. 2 to 500 characters. Max increased to 8K tokens (roughtly 32k chars) when authenticated.
A user identification object with arbitr: A user identification object with arbitrary metadata about the user. Will be saved to the question and conversation. Keys referrer, email, and name are shown in question history logs. Optional, defaults to null.
Number of sources to lookup for the bot: Number of sources to lookup for the bot to answer from. Optional, default is 5. Research mode uses 16 (more expensive token usage).
Whether to enable human escalation for t: Whether to enable human escalation for this question. Optional, default is false.
Whether to ask the user for a follow-up: Whether to ask the user for a follow-up rating after the question is answered. Optional, default is false.
Whether to use the document retriever fo: Whether to use the document retriever for this question. Optional, default is false.
Whether to return the full source conten: Whether to return the full source content in the response. Optional, default is false.
Autocut results to num groups. Optional,: Autocut results to num groups. Optional, defaults to false.
Whether the request is for testing purpo: Whether the request is for testing purposes. Optional, defaults to false.
List of image URLs to include with the q: List of image URLs to include with the question as context. Optional, defaults to null.
Override the model used for this request: Override the model used for this request. Requires an OpenAI API key to be set on your team. Optional, defaults to the model configured for the bot.
The default language to use if the langu: The default language to use if the language of the conversation is unclear. Use locale codes like 'en' or 'en-US'. Optional, defaults to the bot's configured language.
Reasoning depth for the response. Requir: Reasoning depth for the response. Requires authentication to override default.
Can be url, document, sitemap, wp, urls,: Can be url, document, sitemap, wp, urls, csv, rss, qa, youtube. All but url, sitemap, and youtube require uploading a formatted file.
The bot description. Shown by default in: The bot description. Shown by default in embeds and share links.
The bot privacy. Can be public or privat: The bot privacy. Can be public or private.
The embedding model. Currently supports: The embedding model. Currently supports text-embedding-ada-002, text-embedding-3-large, text-embedding-3-small, embed-multilingual-v3.0, and embed-v4.0 (Cohere) depending on your plan.
The ID of an existing bot in your team t: The ID of an existing bot in your team to copy from. If provided, the new bot will be created as a copy of the specified bot, with all sources copied over after creation.
Authorization headers are injected autom: 授权头自动从您的连接中注入。
Enable for files like PDFs, images, etc..
HEAD: 黑色
